H0.text: when did the us dollar leave the gold standard. 1913

H1.text: when did the us dollar leave the gold standard. 1929

H2.text: when did the us dollar leave the gold standard. 1946

H3.text: when did the us dollar leave the gold standard. 1934

A4.text: The United States Gold Reserve Act of January 30, 1934 required that all gold and gold certificates held by the Federal Reserve be surrendered and vested in the sole title of the United States Department of the Treasury.

A5.text: The Gold Reserve Act of 1934 signified that the American people could no longer hold gold, with the exception of jewelry and collectors' coins.
